document: Chapter 3: Machine Learning - Fundamentals of Data Science

questions.question: Arthur Samuel defined machine learning as 'a field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.'
Machine learning is a subfield of artificial intelligence.
Regression and classification are not important applications for data scientists.
Machine learning can only be used in the data modeling phase of the data science process.
Python has very few packages available for machine learning.
SciPy integrates fundamental packages like NumPy, matplotlib, and Pandas.
Pandas introduces dataframes to Python, similar to R.
Scikit-learn is a library filled with machine learning algorithms.
NLTK (Natural Language Toolkit) focuses on image processing.
Numba uses just-in-time compilation to speed up Python applications.
PyCUDA allows code execution on GPUs instead of CPUs.
Cython brings the Java programming language to Python.
Blaze enables working with data sets smaller than computer memory.
PySpark connects Python and Spark, an in-memory big data framework.
The modeling phase consists of two steps: training and validation.
Feature engineering is one of the most important steps in the modeling process.
In practice, features are always readily available in a single data set.
Training a model involves presenting data from which it can learn.
Model validation tests whether a model can be extrapolated to reality.
Classification error rate is used for regression problems.
Mean squared error measures the average error of predictions.
Dividing data into training and holdout sets is an uncommon validation strategy.
K-folds cross validation uses all data available in the data set.
Leave-1 out validation is used only on small data sets.
Applying a model to new data is called model scoring.
Supervised learning techniques require labeled data.
Unsupervised learning techniques rely on labeled data with human interaction.
Semi-supervised learning can progress with both labeled and unlabeled data.
Machine learning is not related to applied mathematics and statistics.
As a phone user writes more text messages, the phone's autocomplete becomes less accurate.
Finding oil fields based on existing sites is an example of classification or regression.
Identifying people based on pictures or voice recordings is a classification problem.
Predicting company revenue is a regression problem.
Machine learning is useless during the data preparation phase.
RPy2 allows calling Python functions from within R.
StatsModels is a package for statistical methods and algorithms.
SymPy is used for symbolic mathematics and computer algebra.
Dispy and IPCluster allow distributing code over computer clusters.
Pydoop connects Python to Hadoop.
Feature engineering involves coming up with and creating possible predictors for the model.
